website_summaries.verdict: DK and his pals are well-represented in this high-action celebration of video gaming’s all-time best characters, and there’s always something new to do in Smash.
pros: Fight as DK, Diddy Kong, series villain King K. Rool, and old friends Banjo and Kazooie
Many Donkey Kong inspired items and stages
Huge online community to play with

website_summaries.verdict: Between its all-star cast, smooth controls, and frequent updates that continue to add more depth to the game, Super Smash Bros. Ultimate is sure to keep you smashing friends and foes alike for a long time to come.
pros: Battle online with a gigantic roster of beloved video game icons, including fan-favorite newcomers like King K. Rool, Ridley, and the Inklings
Easy to learn, difficult to master
cons: The addition of DLC fighters like Banjo & Kazooie and Piranha Plant is extremely exciting, but the bonus characters will cost you extra

customer_reviews.title: Shallow plus weak online!
customer_reviews.text: Visually it's great and tons of characters/stages but the overall concept of the game is shallow. Just a silly fighting game with zero depth. You do the same thing over and over and over. Biggest problem is that I cant play online with My FRIENDS against random other players. So sick of getting Nintendoed!
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: So... much... content.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those games where the creators really try to do their best to pack-in EVERYTHING in one tiny little cartridge for a standard price. The game has you start out with just EIGHT characters! If you've been caught up with the game and seen how it works, you already know that the character roster is INSANE. Hours upon hours will be spent unlocking everybody!
customer_reviews.author: Joey Peat

customer_reviews.title: Ruined a classic
customer_reviews.text: This game is absolutely lacking in logic and extremely frustrating to play. Do not recommend. Unfair to the player and biased towards CPU. Has too much nerdy lingo going on to comprehend and remarkably complicated to be marketed as a children’s game. I have to record the gameplay and rewatch just to understand what has happened to be defeated and still am often left bewildered and red in the face
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Please don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Look, I tried to give smash a chance I really did. It's boring and I don't understand the hype for this game. The movements are stiff and it's far from smooth. For months people hyped this game up. I wasted 52.00 dollars on a mediocre game. You only have 4 moves !! Amazon you get 5 stars for delivering my games on time. Lol
customer_reviews.author: The Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother, just stick with Brawl
customer_reviews.text: Setting up your own matches is classic smash bros fun. Everything else is complete garbage. The new "spirits" mode that you have to play to unlock charecters is a hideous waste of time, with special rules to ensure that the outcome is based solely on luck rather than skill. You can try your hardest and loose in seconds, or you can set the controller down, and win. No, tgat is not an exaggeration, I've actually done it. This translates to hours and hours of essentially rolling dice. Definitely not what I look for in a game.
customer_reviews.author: DrunkenGenuous

customer_reviews.title: Super Smash Bros Ultimate Fun
customer_reviews.text: Oh, boy, I would love to be mashing my joycons playing this game right now. But guess what? Looks like the package isn’t on track, and is now expected December 8-11. So much for pre-ordering. Update: So it came the next morning. It makes sense since it was just released today! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: S. K.

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate indeed
customer_reviews.text: My freind told me pokemon lets go pikachu/eevee will outsell super smash ultimate.... I told him he needs to go seek medical help asap.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.Top Contributor: Anime

customer_reviews.title: where’s mario??? 1 star
customer_reviews.text: Mario still hasn’t made an appearance in smash brothers. I mean come on microsoft, but everyone else is in the game, even the girls from dead or alive. my friends say its better with the GameCube cobtrollers but even that also sucks. I plug in the game cube and none of the three buttons work except for one and all that does is flip open the disk reader. and that’s why I’m rating just dance at a 3/5. technology works efficiently but it’s too gimmicky and repetitive
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Nieto

customer_reviews.title: RECEIVED CASE ONLY
customer_reviews.text: Boy am I livid. I had been waiting patiently for my physical copy to arrive and was looking forward to playing it after work the day it arrived. I opened up my SEALED case and it was EMPTY. NO MANUAL NO CARTRIDGE!!! WTF how does this even happen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unplayable online and awful single player content, feels like half a game
customer_reviews.text: (Update after Terry had just released, since having the game day 1) Online is terrible, single player is terrible. Outside of playing locally with friends this game is worthless. The single player experience boils down to "Did the AI read you controller and just cheat to win or was it unbelievably useless and walked off a cliff?" There isn't much in between. The online multiplayer is a lag fest slide show most times, and barely playable at others. I do not get the praise.
customer_reviews.author: Subo

customer_reviews.title: Believe the hype
customer_reviews.text: Have played about 3 hours so far and am really happy with this game. World of Light is a really interesting way to keep the content fresh and the characters unlock at a steady pace. Definitely lived up to the hype.
customer_reviews.author: MntnDew

customer_reviews.title: Unreal
customer_reviews.text: This game is absolutely crazy. Love the new animations and feel of the game. Even joker is going to be in it! What else can we ask for
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Wang

customer_reviews.title: Online is Hot Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Imagine you are playing one of those popular Call of duty games that all the kids are playing now adays. Now imagine you want to play team deathmatch, you tell the game that all you want to do is play team deathmatch but instead it keeps aggressively rubbing your crotch with a cheese grinder until all that is left is the bloody pulp of what used to be your manhood. Steer clear of this game for now if you are trying to have any sort of skill based online gameplay. All that you are going to find here is ffa with all items turned on. Tldr: 5/5 game ruined by Nintendo's ineptitude with anything that connects to the interwebs.
customer_reviews.author: Keebs

customer_reviews.title: Great game, but too much DLC content
customer_reviews.text: Tons of characters are only attainable in DLC packs, of which there are many. Good game though, just tired of paying through the nose to get part of a game and then having to pay more to get the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I didn't really find it particularly enjoyable like everybody else did mostly because the characters feel even harder to control than the previous game I do like the fact that you have to unlock almost every character in the game I guess but that means you're required to spend at least 10 hours unlocking characters. And there's no guarantee within that 10 hours period that you're going to unlock every character. But considering in the adventure mode the first character you're able to use his Kirby witch honestly I don't like Kirby kind of kills it for me I would have honestly preferred anybody else first in the adventure mode
customer_reviews.author: kevin clyde

customer_reviews.title: Awful Online and poor balance overall
customer_reviews.text: First off the game definitely has potential, but the Online is atrocious. For starters, you have to pay separately for online unlike Ninentdo’s previous online systems. This wouldn’t be so bad if the online itself was well executed, but it’s awful. You can request a 1 vs 1 match, yet end up in a 4-player Free For All with items on everywhere. Oh, and if you disconnect from the game you didn’t want? That’s a penalty, so no more online for you for a while! The game also has some awful balancing. Characters like Inklings, Bowser, and Charizard are ridiculously overpowered. It makes playing “worse” characters not fun at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: First Smash game I’ve played since the N64 one. There are a lot of hidden mechanics and things to master in this game. A lot of the reviews on Amazon are so harsh it’s actually funny. I really am enjoying this and am learning how to master aspects of it all the time. Great to play with other people online and on the couch!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Amazing game. If you're a fan of the Smash series, it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pass
customer_reviews.text: This game is a mess. The developers tried to cram a whole bunch of crap into this game. Not to seem like I'm living in the past... but the Super Smash Bros games for the N64 / Gamecube were much much better. This one has a single player mode called Adventure Mode, which is a headache. The whole spirit thing they've added in this game probably ought not to be there. The graphics are pretty good, admittedly, although sometimes the screen is such a jumbled chaotic mess that you'll strain your eyes trying to track your characters' position in the map. Anyway, this was fifty bucks wasted for me. Your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not good for new/casual players...
customer_reviews.text: If you’ve never played smash before or are a super casual gamer this game is not for you. It is incredibly difficult and unforgiving with no tutorial.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Good luck unlocking characters.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love this game, but as a person who buys these games for the vast assortment of characters to play with it’s extremely annoying to find out you only start with 8 and have to unlock the rest. I simply don’t have the time or the patience to do this the normal way, and even using a method to speed up the process, beating the characters to unlock them is WAY too hard. I’d say I only unlock about 2 out of every 10 I fight. I bought this to just enjoy the game, but it’s hard to enjoy it when I’m spending all my time just trying to unlock the characters I actually want to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Conor Metz

customer_reviews.title: The definitive mobile Smash with realized single player
customer_reviews.text: Smash Ultimate is the best-looking game on the Switch in hand-held mode. This is the definitive mobile version of Smash, and it runs beautifully. The single player content is outstanding. While I thought World of Light was decent, Spirit Board is an addicting collectible mode for people like me who want to pick-up-and-play. Each character getting their own themed Classic Mode is also really cool. One of my favorite changes is that the challenges aren't totally brutal overall. No "complete X mode with every character" stuff. Multiplayer leaves a lot to be desired, though I've had lots of fun by avoiding Quickplay matchmaking and taking turns sparring with others in Arena.
customer_reviews.author: neverr

customer_reviews.title: One of best games on Switch
customer_reviews.text: I always take my switch whenever we go somewhere far with my little cousins. When they are bored as hell when their cell phones are taken away, I just pop my switch out with super smash, oh man, they swarm you like little hungry mosquito. So many characters to choose from and intense fighting, make them joyful for many hours. I also grew up playing smash on N64 and I can easily join them and play together. Thank you nintendo for making this great game and I really appreciate this.
customer_reviews.author: BenKaTop Contributor: Clarinets

customer_reviews.title: Online PvP Still Horrible March 2019
customer_reviews.text: There is no chance whatsoever of playing with anyone online. The game lags so horribly, you'll be grabbing someone one second, and the next second you'll be off the screen because they apparently smashed you. Check the real reviews online, away from Amazon. Online play is horrible. Nintendo needs to synchronize a little better amigo.
customer_reviews.author: Day 1 Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: Xmas Winner
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my super dope 30-year-old brother who wanted this for Xmas. I only had to buy this one thing. And he loved it. It was very unexciting, though. Only one present. It was $60... I'm not gonna get him more than this, you know? But I felt bad, like, sorry you don't have more presents to open, but, I mean... this was expensive. SO I'd recommend this if you like this game (I wouldn't know how the game is, only how it is received as a present/makes 30-year-old Gamer/IT Programmers feel @ Christmas) or if you need to get on the good side of some nerd. Just kidding. Happy Holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron J Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Good game
customer_reviews.text: This is fun overall but not a five star game by any means. It is more like a 3.5 so I just rounded to 4 but the kids played a good bit the first week then its fun started to fizzle out. In comparison, I bought a few games for a stay-at-home stimulus package. Most of the games cost much less than this one and they are playing two so far. One for one-third the price of this one is being played by everyone for weeks now. Again this is a good game but they wanted more variety it seems.
customer_reviews.author: Schlep

customer_reviews.title: Called Ultimate for Good Reason
customer_reviews.text: This game is full of hundreds of hours of play. Although I wish world of light would have had more too it. I also wish that they would have kept hit the targets and homerun contest but you can't get it all. The game is a ton of fun and great with friends. Though the game is only fun when you have a ton of people playing. I also feel that their internet service still needs to be fixed. Way to much lag input problems and my other online games on other consoles do not have this problem. However even with these issues I love this game! Easily one of the best games on the nintendo switch.
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: I am a new player, here is what I thought...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game, with a lot of fun. But it is not an easy game. I am pretty good at fighting game, such as KOF and Dragon ball Z fighter. But this game gives me some hard time on the adventure. Any battle that higher than 3 star is really hard and pain. Again, I am new player to this game. Pretty sure it can get better once I pritice more. All I am saying is be ready, don’t expect an easy family game. It is really not that low.
customer_reviews.author: DFrrest

customer_reviews.title: Confusing and no fun
customer_reviews.text: My biggest issue with this game is simply keeping up with the characters. The background moves and changes color, the camera moves in and out making the fighters very small at times. It's just impossible to tell where you're at, if you're hitting anyone, or if you're getting hit. Couldn't send back so I put it on ebay.
customer_reviews.author: J. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: AAA Title with a price to match
customer_reviews.text: If you can find it on sale, get it. It's so easy to pick up but it will take a lifetime to master. My 5 yr old son plays with me and he has a bit of trouble playing it, but he actually picked it up quick. He plays as donkey Kong and I've been putting him to work to unlock the characters for me. This is a must have since I actually get to work while the switch babysits him. Wooo!
customer_reviews.author: R. Dinh

customer_reviews.title: I recieved a bad copy
customer_reviews.text: ***READ BEFORE JUDGING ME*** Ok The Game is Amazing. The Controls are excelent and feels great and the game is best but the copy i recieved was awful. The game care could not read until I tried reinserting a bunch of times. Then when it did read the game had a corrupt data problem with me having to redownload so many times until finally it worked but I still have to redownload and repeat until the game works. I guess I recieved a “bad apple” copy but this makes me want to go digital.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my son’s Christmas present (Christmas 2019) and because he had other games playing with, he just opened the game case this past weekend (April 11th) only to find that the game was not in the case. Maybe this was an oversight but I’m extremely disappointed as had he opened this at Christmas last year, it would have been disastrous. Please ensure that this doesn’t happen to other faithful and loyal Amazon clients or anybody. Paul Russell.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Add to my daughters' favorites
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughters' Christmas last year, and we think they ceased to play all other games momentarily. This game had my girls, aged 11 & 13, playing and giggling together like best friends, which I loved. They spent all their waking, free hours playing it, which I did not love. This game is the reason for our current game time limits, which were not needed before we got this game. I do not know whether that is due more to their ages or this game...judging from the chatter about it with other kids, though, I tend to think it was the game. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Past In the Present
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun! The adventure is alright but a little long. However, if you like story modes you’ll enjoy it. I’m just crunching through it so I can get all the characters. This game is slot of fun though! It’s beautiful and it will being in all the precious super smash bros and adds a few other features that gives you the best of both worlds. If you’re a fan of super smash you need to get this game! Online play is a fun bonus to when your buddies aren’t around.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Birrell

customer_reviews.title: I will always love Smash Bros
customer_reviews.text: Has all of the nostalgia of the old game, but with all the new flare! New characters, moves, and a great story mode. I like the idea of physical cartridges for if you want to swap games with friends/relatives, and they’re less storage on your console. The digital downloads are nice too though for if you want to navigate to different games without having to get up and switch out your game.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Renee

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware: False Copies
customer_reviews.text: I am most likely less than 1% of the buy experience, but caution of Super Smash replicas. I had initially thought that it was the actual Super Smash Bros. Ultimate but after further inspection by putting in the switch and the game cartridge itself, it turned out to be fake (I received a $15 game). Everything was imitated with a paper cover and also paper on the game itself. I was actually excited to receive this product (would have gave a 5) but the 1 star is just for my personal experience.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: A fun game for any situation
customer_reviews.text: It's fun and easy to learn. There is a huge roster, and most characters feel unique. I can play this on a 10 minute break, or an evening hosting friends. It's great that I don't feel like I have to play this connected to the base/TV to really enjoy it like some other games.
customer_reviews.author: Nikesh Patel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: It's Smash that's portable, that includes every character ever included in a Smash game and has good physics (coming from someone who's last Smash was Brawl). The online has a few issues, but I stick to playing with friends in private online matches anyway so I don't really encounter many of those problems.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Bothell

customer_reviews.title: Just Plain old fun
customer_reviews.text: If you never played a smash bros game, this would be the best time to get this game, it has everyone from past smash bros games, with a few new characters and really good amount of stages. I play this game with my 5 year old nephew and he loves it, I just love to sit with him and play for hours unlocking new characters, the memories this game makes in itself is well worth it and something money can't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Islandcollector88

customer_reviews.title: samus aran
customer_reviews.text: DOnt really care for all the other characters or online dont even play the switch online any way only one reason why i get super smash bros is my beloved samus aran crazy for her got everthing for switch samus aran skins controller stickers cases posters figures amiibos shirts custom made jackets helmets everything possible did i mention im a really big big big fan of samus aran oh yea i did and yes thats why i buy smash bros only for her and this game playing on tv or car i can go with her every were lol 5 star and got my copy yesterday from amazon thanks
customer_reviews.author: Samus Aran

customer_reviews.title: Best Super Smash Bros.
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing Smash since the first one. I was pretty close to pro level in Brawl (I know it's not great, you don't need to tell me). This one is absolutely incredible. The mechanics have been tweaked enough to differentiate it from Smash 4. The character roster is absolutely insane. WOLF IS BACK!!!! Their are only two negatives here: 1) The mini games (break the targets, board the platforms, home run contest, etc.) are gone 2) World of Light is pretty meh. This is a must have for any Nintendo Switch owner.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun
customer_reviews.text: Super smash bros ultimate is one of the best smash bros ive played. I threw two parties this weekend and everybody had tons of fun playing it to where two of my friends are going to buy a switch just for this game. There is a lot of new stuff like characters maps spirits and game modes. A con for former smash bros players is that its going to feel repetitive because at the end of the day you use the same character you always use on your favorite map. But for new people it is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, another switch classic!
customer_reviews.text: This game is amazing! If you own a switch and enjoy fighting games then you need this one! I consider it to be a must have switch game right alongside breath of the wild, splatoon 2 and Mario odyssey! I haven't been able to put it down for long since receiving it.
customer_reviews.author: C.A.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GAME!
customer_reviews.text: Great game! Haven’t played since N64 edition. Brings back great memories. FYI N64 controllers can take more abuse. If you are losing Switch controllers can’t handle throwing. If you flick it. Towards a pillow/couch a few times you are safe. Throw with a floor skip and walk smash not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Joe C

customer_reviews.title: Someone stole our switch.
customer_reviews.text: I gifted my daughter Smash Bro’s as an early Christmas present. We realized our switch was stolen. We held each other and cried. She lost all her game play in Zelda and I’m not going to spend Christmas break playing smash bros with my girl. 😭.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kay

customer_reviews.title: The must have on Switch
customer_reviews.text: I bought the console just for this, and it was well worth it. If you have ever played any of the previous titles than this is nostalgia at its finest. If not, then you will see why so many have fallen in love with the series, and a cult following has developed. The best choice characters Nintendo and beyond in an all out war. The perfect fighting game for anyone who doesn't care for the rigid format of traditional fighting games of the day
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Brown

customer_reviews.title: Excellent game for Nintendo Switch !!!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love it !!! Excellent game for Nintendo Switch !!!
customer_reviews.author: FRANCISCO MARQUEZ

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic game. Worth picking up again.
customer_reviews.text: Sakurai is loved for this series. And players should see why once they've experienced the flood of content in this game. Competitive and DLC packs seem to be where their effort is right now. Online is an improvement, but is still not enjoyable for most people due to input delay. The CPUs are less BS to fight while also being much more savage with edge guarding and meteors. (Previous CPUs in Smash 4 had perfect responses with inhuman execution allowing for perfect dodges & frame perfect moves to trump player input at the instance) Just pick this up. You don't need to read reviews for Smash games.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Game!
customer_reviews.text: The game is great and reminds me of previous versions, but it has much better graphics, performance and responsiveness than previous versions. The amount of levels and characters with unique traits and moves is astounding. The music and sound effects are also great and all of the positive attributes of this game make it addicting to play. I will be playing this on the train to work for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: SteveWithAnS

customer_reviews.title: Your life will be over...
customer_reviews.text: I've always loved playing the Smash Bros series but this game is so much more. I started playing Smash Bros Ultimate as soon as it came in, since then my girlfriend left me (because I forgot I had one), my cat ran out of food and started eating my legs because he thought I had died, and I almost passed out because of a horrible smell in my house but came to realize that that smell was me. On the bright side, I have lost a few pounds because I haven't eaten in over a week now. Please send help!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Brings back many memories
customer_reviews.text: This is a much much better game than smash 4, it’s almost like melee but more refined. It’s a faster pace game than brawl was and smash 4. The amount of characters to choose from in this game is one of part of the game and every character seems like reasonably balanced, there are a few exceptions now and there but that’s to be expected. There is no such thing as perfect, at least in my opinion, but this iteration of smash is as close to it as any of the ones before it.
customer_reviews.author: iPawl

customer_reviews.title: Everyone is here!
customer_reviews.text: If you've played a Smash Bros game then you know what to expect. This version has more characters than ever, with all the characters who have ever been playable in Smash coming back. Nearly all the stages are back as well, and tons of music too. Smash Ultimate plays a bit more quick than the 3DS/WiiU versions did, making the game more fast paced in general. Lots of stuff to unlock, and just so much fun to play with friends. The online component is a bit iffy at times, but it's been improving.
customer_reviews.author: Eric M. Harris

customer_reviews.title: "Smusher Smash" is the best
customer_reviews.text: This game is so fun! My kids love it and have enjoyed playing the game and unlocking more characters. I can also say that it has caused some contention around our household, but the game encourages you to get better. My 5 year old couldn't help but call it Smusher Smash, so that is the name it is know as around our household. Fun game play and very enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: KJESPOKO

customer_reviews.title: Its a matter of fact! Smash is back!!!!
customer_reviews.text: What more could be said? It's pretty much the ultimate version of Smash bros. Tons of characters to unlock, an amazing adventure mode featuring spirits we know and love. Plus, classic mode! Do you have what it takes to reach the end? As for the online some have had good experiences some bad. You know how it goes first few days of a game? Overall if your looking for a good time with your friends/family nothing beats grabbing the joycons or gamecube controller and having a blast.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Seriously amazing game!
customer_reviews.text: Story mode was a solid 20 hours or so of gameplay and I loved every bit of it. You start out as Kirby and then get to battle and win every character. There are way more than in other games and a lot of fun moves to discover. A couple of the dungeons were confusing and took a glance on the Google to figure out but eventually got them completed. Overall one of my favorite switch games and would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Just an excellent game
customer_reviews.text: I've played every single smash game since the n64. This is the best one yet. It combines the best of Melee, Brawl & Smash for Wii U. The single player mode is amazing on its own. Online is great as long as you have an ethernet adapter and you play with wireless controllers. I actually ended up settling on the Pro Controller which is working well for me, which is surprising because I was certain I would want to use the Gamecube controller & adapter. YMMV. But if you've been on the fence about this, GET THIS GAME.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Super Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: You will start with one fighter, and your goal is to bring balance to light and dark. Along the way you will gain spirits which will give you perks in battle. Having the right spirit in a battle can make a big difference. There can be up to 3 different endings in the game. There is an optional tutorial if you want to take it. This is a rather basic fighting game and is very easy to pick up. I am not a fan of fighting games, and found this game alot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: S Crow

customer_reviews.title: Lots of characters, stages and battles to be had.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing game, easily the best of the series thus far. Lots of characters to choose from, with lots of stages to battle on. While it might take a while to unlock all the characters, it was still fun to see who would show up next. The new story mode, while fun, was a little too difficult for me at times, and I went about unlocking characters the old fashioned way. As for controls, the usual Smash rules from Melee onwards are still the norm and as a result the GameCube controller is the best way to play competitively.
customer_reviews.author: Sainijon

customer_reviews.title: Not really impressed, for now.
customer_reviews.text: Was expecting something funner TBH. Daughter loves it, but I find the controls to be awkward and the whole experience somewhat frantic. I probably need more practice, but it doesn't help that there was no tutorial for a first timer into the series. Just learn as you button mash... I did get a laugh out of me and my daughter fighting against a bunch of cpu players though :) nobody knew what the heck was going on most of the time, but it was funny at least.
customer_reviews.author: andrzej raczynski

customer_reviews.title: Great game but very difficult for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: I never played Smash Bros that much before and I decided to pre order this game. However, even if it's very hard there are guides on YouTube and customization with controls for your liking to make it easier to play. I am still struggling to fight against the CPU players. However, for me personally it's a great experience so far. If you look at the game as a whole it was what I actually expected for the price and content. However, if it gets too frustrating to play I might update this review but overall I love playing Smash Ultimate.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Mishkin

customer_reviews.title: What do you need to say this is the Ultimate Smash!
customer_reviews.text: The game is amazing, from the maps to the vast amount of fighters there is no shortage of content. The graphics are great and the world of light mode is a lot of fun. The game also is given a constant stream of support and events. There are so many small things to appreciate, such as the ability to change the menu music to the N64 version. The multiplayer does need some work in my opinion, but it is still great. P.S. WHERE IS WALUIGI?!?!
customer_reviews.author: David McCahon

customer_reviews.title: All family squabbles are started & finished here!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super Smash brings the whole family together in a knockdown drag out fight & that's even before anyone gets a controller! But seriously this is a great game, had a 30 yr old, 20 yr old, 14 yr old, & a 7 yr old all playing at the same time (all were actively engaged & away from their cellphones). An absolute must if you have a Nintendo Switch!!!
customer_reviews.author: Master Blaster 727

customer_reviews.title: Best crossover game ever!
customer_reviews.text: The story mode and the various maps throughout the game are a sight to behold! So many cool fighters to choose from, and the boss battles are epic too! It is also fascinating how one of the DLC maps changes base color depending on the music chosen. Highly recommend this game to other Nintendo Switch players.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah J.

customer_reviews.title: MOAB
customer_reviews.text: All I ever wanted out of a Smash game. Beautiful graphics. Strong mechanics. Lots to do. My wife and I are well over 100 hours into this game (most of that was spent brawling it out against each other while earning characters) and we are not even close to burnt out. Worth buying a switch just for this game? Yes. There are plenty of other titles that make the switch worth every penny, but this one is the MOAB of this system. (MOAB- an acronym for the United States military ordinance entitled “Mother of all Bombs.”)
customer_reviews.author: Uhila

customer_reviews.title: ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ GREAT FOR DEXTERITY and THE INTELLECT ★ ★ ★ ★ ★
customer_reviews.text: Our grade school kids love this game! My son is a huge gamer and his handwriting has improved significantly since playing this during 'tech time' ... It also keeps the mind sharp because it moves very fast and you have to make quick decisions to progress in the game. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: GA_PEACH

customer_reviews.title: Why haven’t you bought this yet?!
customer_reviews.text: Great for all ages! Packed with nostalgia and good old fashion character vs. character fighting. My boyfriend and I play for hours and when we take it places, it’s the life of the party. Probably the first game I didn’t feel guilty paying $70 bucks for. If you’re a Nintendo fan at all, you’ll be happy you made the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Klp721

customer_reviews.title: It's a beautiful game.
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review on behalf of my teenage son, who ordered this game. When I asked him what he thought of the game, he said," It's a beautiful game." I honestly have never heard that said of a game before and I had to laugh. But he takes his videogaming seriously. He loves this new version of Super Smash Brothers and has even set up a tournament with his friends with a Super Smash Brothers Ultimate game as the prize for the winner.
customer_reviews.author: crossingborders

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fun but online is trash.
customer_reviews.text: I’d probably give this four stars if online was good, but, unfortunately, it is a terrible lagfest without a true 1v1 mode. I dock another star because the game play is a bit too simple. Characters have very little depth and it is difficult to differentiate yourself from other players due to the lack of options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A bit scary for 8 year olds
customer_reviews.text: My 8-year-olds requested this game for their birthday. They LOVE this game, however, they request the light stays on at night. Some of the characters are quite scary. Next time I'll stick to the suggested age on the front...My bad.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. D

customer_reviews.title: Missing Game Cartridge
customer_reviews.text: Opened my SEALED copy and discovered there was no game cartridge included. Absolutely mental that this is even a possibility. Looking at the reviews, this isn't even that uncommon. Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Kinsey

customer_reviews.title: Hate Nintendo, but kids love the game.
customer_reviews.text: My son is enjoying the game, FWIW. But I hate Nintendo. Why do I have 7 different kinds of accounts, and I could not download this title until I straighted them out. Also, now we need a monthly subscription account to play core elements of the game that I already bought? Thanks Nintendo.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Imbalanced mess, pay to win DLC
customer_reviews.text: Still miserably balanced from Wii U, didn't fix anything that needed to be fixed. Adding more characters was the last thing it needed because it's now even worse, trimming the fat and making a better game was the missing improvement and they moved in the opposite direction. Don't commit a lot of time to it. The release of Joker shows that this is going to be another pay to win game like Smash 4.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Pre ordered
customer_reviews.text: Pre ordered a month in advance, while everyone got to play on opening day I had to wait 5 days later
customer_reviews.author: M. Camberos

customer_reviews.title: BEST GAME EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Super Smash Bros Ultimate was a game that I’ve been looking forward to play, I’ve always love the Smash Bros franchise since the original N64. With new and old characters that I know and start playing. Wonderful game and perfect price for the game. I was originally gonna keep that money for another Figuarts, but I really need this game.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Ordonez

customer_reviews.title: Best Super Smash
customer_reviews.text: From the little bit that I've played, it's been amazing. The mechanics are good, the different characters that I have played are very different from each other. Even characters that are similar to each other each have their own differences in terms of moves and stats. It's very impressive. There is a single player campaign, but it isn't necessary to play to have a great experience.
customer_reviews.author: Scorv

customer_reviews.title: I love this game.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite Smash Bros game was from the Nintendo 64. I feel that this version is very well done. Some people feel that the card system associated with the single player mode is a little silly, but I feel that it adds a different spin on the regular game. I recommend this game for fans of the Smash Bros games.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Embarrassingly poor controller response
customer_reviews.text: Not even the pro controller will make you feel like you're in control. It feels mushy like playing on the Wii, this must be why Nintendo is pushing the game cube controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Sam

customer_reviews.title: Totally inconsistent online experience
customer_reviews.text: Most of the time online works reasonably well, then sometimes it will be an absolute slideshow. There is no reason whatsoever for the game to not judge somebody's connection speed and discourage them from playing if their connection is bad. There is no reason for matchmaking to force two players into a game if their connection to the other is abysmal.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: New Sealed Game, Missing Cartridge
customer_reviews.text: Not a review of the game itself. Bought a new sealed copy of the game and there was no game cartridge when I opened it. Looked all around me to see if I accidentally dropped it somehow, but nope. No cartridge and no booklet (if it even came with one). Also tried to look for a download code but there was nothing of the sort. Thats about $50 that I spent on literally nothing.
customer_reviews.author: K.T.

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: The story mode doesn’t beat SSBB and it should have multiplayer mode for story mode (spirits) but the majority of smash bros is regular brawls with friends and this game feels so much more polished and smoother than the older games. More balanced too besides the DLC characters and lil Mac
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: It's a must have to families
customer_reviews.text: With so many characters to choose from you really can't ever go wrong love the fact that there is many different game modes so there's always something to do and the fact that it also has online play if you have the Nintendo switch online I can't really say anything bad about this game it is a must-have for families as a person that played the original N64 love it
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the original!
customer_reviews.text: I used to play this growing up so I got it for my 5 year old. He loves the combination of all the characters in one game. His two favorite types of games would be battling and adventure so this was perfect. We did have issues figuring out how to make it two player! Felt like that could have been better but other than that no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: I guess I’m old now
customer_reviews.text: Way too much happening on the screen at one time. A real cluster, if you catch my drift. Seems harder than the originals. Lots of characters and levels. Its all just too much for my mind to handle anymore I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: TheWoollyHannoth

customer_reviews.title: Great Smash Bros. game! Just needs to add/update certain things.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely one of my favorite Switch games! Co-Op in Battle Arena needs to included in an update because playing co-op online shouldn't just be obligated to Quick Plays. There was co-op online against other friends in Brawl and Wii U/3DS, so there should be no reason to exclude it in Ultimate. I hope to see it included very soon (yes Nintendo, I'm implying that you're going to do this or keep getting fan complaints to where you'll be forced to). Other than that and the online matchmaking itself, playing locally is great and the World of Light adventure mode is pretty cool!
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Greatest iteration of smash bros to date
customer_reviews.text: I've played all past variations of Smash Bros, well into the late night, for many many hours. This one is by far my favorite. Plus, if you don't know how to play, you can make it crazy enough that your chances of winning are still very good! We've had my kids and all their friends all playing and laughing and having a great time many times. Just a great game all around!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Kept my college and teenager girls from boredom ...
customer_reviews.text: Helped my two bored kids from this stay at home restriction, now they play this game like there’s no tomorrow!
customer_reviews.author: RobF18x

customer_reviews.title: Received an EMPTY Case..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother for Christmas, it came factory sealed, but when he opened it on Christmas it was EMPTY. The game card was not in the factory sealed box... It was a MAJOR let down..
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Step up from Smash4 but step down from Brawl
customer_reviews.text: Best Smash game to date with: tons of music, characters, and stages. The core gameplay is improved. It's an awesome party game. Story mode and single player content is a step down from Brawl but a step up from Smash 4. Online is not that great though.
customer_reviews.author: Choosy Chica

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: So much fun! My kiddos have played this with their friend, so when they got their own switch I had to buy it. They love all the characters. I now have to set time limits because they will play all day.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great new game alternative to brawl.
customer_reviews.text: The Mario brothers have finally released a smash hit squequal to the hit Wii game brawl. I was excommunicated by the melee and smash 4 community years ago, so it will be nice being back in a thriving community. I lost a lot or friends fighting over the validity of the tripping mechanic. My "pal" Rico Elroy routinely would humiliate me in front of my long time ex-flame Jenifer Wu (gamertag: Frostedk1tten). Needless to say I will be looking forward to using the piranha plant (my main) to crush Ricos stupid guy. I hate Rice. I mean Rico. Sorry autocorrect... dont get me started.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Moore

customer_reviews.title: Fun that doesn't stop!
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun game! Best mode is the Smash mode with multiple players in your party, but if you're playing alone the story mode and challenges will keep you entertained for hours on end. Sometimes there is nothing like the original, but the progression of the smash franchise is one of the best I've seen. 5 stars no doubt
customer_reviews.author: Spartano15

customer_reviews.title: Super Smash Bros. The Best
customer_reviews.text: The best Switch game to date, blows Mario and Zelda out of the water. Everything is tightened up in the latest entry all around. World of light has some fun aspects although it carries on far too long than it should. Roster is to the best it has ever been and probably will be, m especially with upcoming Dlc. One of those games that will forever be enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P

customer_reviews.title: great game
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old son wanted this game for his birthday. He loves it, so does my 12 year old son.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: Fun fighting game. You can play against the computer, friends and family, or online. Great fun
customer_reviews.author: Judith A

customer_reviews.title: Online mode is lacking, to put it politely
customer_reviews.text: Of course the gameplay is addicting and the fighting system is geniously deep yet simple at the same time Etc etc, but my problem is the online is absolutely trash. Do not go in expecting it to work honestly. But other than that, this really is one for the history books.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Tannehill

customer_reviews.title: No substitute
customer_reviews.text: Although I specialize in tech reviews, my daughter is the Switch expert. We’ve had Super Smash Bros in other Nintendo gaming formats, so this was at the top of the list for the new Switch. As expected: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Game is perfect, but rewards missing
customer_reviews.text: The game is great and was delivered quickly. However, I purchased this particular listing because it came with a $10 reward for later use, and it still hasn’t been credited to my account. I can’t even look at the details of the credit, because they’re not showing on the listing anymore, which is frustrating to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: A great game to play with friends!
customer_reviews.text: Want to play against your friends in a fun and thrilling way that losses your concept of time? This is definitely the game for you!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Martineau

customer_reviews.title: Senpai + Inklings = Squidpie
customer_reviews.text: There are so many characters in this game. And the variety of the inkling costumes alone are worth the money. But mostly, this is smash brothers, it doesn't matter if this game is good or bad, people will buy it. There's like a million characters in this game. How can you not like this game? Well it isn't as good as melee but way way way better than Smash 64 and all the other smash games.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnysan

customer_reviews.title: A day late, but worth the wait
customer_reviews.text: Came as expected, however was a day late. Seems to happen every now and then, dissapointing but doesnt affect the quality of the game in any way, shape or form. I guess the driver could prioritize his route better, but i havent a clue.
customer_reviews.author: Matt C.

product_meta.title: Super Smash Bros. Ultimate - Nintendo Switch
product_meta.description:
Platform:Nintendo Switch| Edition:Standard

Gaming icons clash in the ultimate brawl you can play anytime, anywhere Smash rivals off the stage as new characters Simon Belmont and King K. Rool join Inkling, Ridley, and every fighter in Super Smash Bros. history. Enjoy enhanced speed and combat at new stages based on the Castlevania series, Super Mario Odyssey, and more 

Having trouble choosing a stage? Then select the Stage Morph option to transform one stage into another while battling—a series first Plus, new echo fighters Dark Samus, Richter Belmont, and Chrom join the battle. Whether you play locally or online, savor the faster combat, new attacks, and new defensive options, like a perfect shield. Jam out to 900 different music compositions and go 1-on-1 with a friend, hold a 4-player free-for-all, kick it up to 8-player battles and more Feel free to bust out your GameCube controllers—legendary couch competitions await—or play together anytime, anywhere Genre action and fighting.

No. of Players up to 8 players

Rom File Size 14.2 GB
feature_bullets: New stages and fighters are joined by the combined rosters of every past Super Smash Bros. game
Challenge others anytime, anywhere, whether you're on the couch or on the go
Play any way you want—locally, online, in TV mode, Tabletop mode, Handheld mode, or even with GameCube Controllers
Fight faster and smarter with new and returning techniques, like the perfect shield and directional air dodge
Face off in 2-4 player battles, or play against the computer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars18,172 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
